[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Trait: ElGamalFriendlyGroup] [Cryptographic Correctness] Does the trait definition enforce cryptographic group properties (closure, associativity, identity, inverse), or can malicious implementations violate group axioms leading to broken encryption and key recovery? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Trait: ElGamalFriendlyGroup::rand_scalar] [Weak Randomness] Can an attacker exploit insufficient entropy or predictable RNG implementations to generate predictable scalars, enabling private key prediction and ciphertext decryption across validator nodes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Trait: ElGamalFriendlyGroup::generator_mul] [Small Subgroup Attack] Does generator_mul validate that the resulting element is in the correct prime-order subgroup, or can attackers force operations in small subgroups to leak private key bits through discrete log solving? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Trait: ElGamalFriendlyGroup::add] [Group Operation Security] Are group addition operations resistant to exceptional points and edge cases, or can attackers supply crafted elements causing undefined behavior, panics, or incorrect computation results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Trait: ElGamalFriendlyGroup::sub] [Integer Underflow] Does group subtraction handle modular arithmetic correctly, or can subtraction operations cause integer underflow in scalar implementations leading to key material corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Trait: ElGamalFriendlyGroup::mul] [Timing Side-Channel] Are scalar multiplication operations constant-time, or does variable-time execution leak private key bits through timing analysis during decryption on validator nodes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Trait: ElGamalFriendlyGroup::rand_element] [Bias in Random Sampling] Does rand_element produce uniformly distributed group elements, or can biased sampling enable statistical attacks to distinguish encryptions or predict future randomness? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Trait: ElGamalFriendlyGroup] [Identity Element Handling] Do group operations properly handle the identity element (point at infinity), or can attackers supply identity elements in ciphertexts to trivially decrypt messages or cause panics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Trait: ElGamalFriendlyGroup] [Element Validation] Does the trait require validation that elements are valid group members before operations, or can invalid curve points cause cryptographic failures or security bypasses? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Trait: ElGamalFriendlyGroup] [Cross-Implementation Compatibility] Can different ElGamalFriendlyGroup implementations produce incompatible ciphertexts or keys, leading to consensus failures when validators use different curve implementations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: key_gen] [Weak Key Generation] Can an attacker predict private keys by exploiting weak RNG seeding in the CryptoRng implementation passed to key_gen, enabling full key recovery and fund theft? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: key_gen] [Zero Scalar Generation] Does key_gen validate that the generated scalar sk is non-zero, or can a zero private key be generated leading to trivial public key compromise and complete loss of confidentiality? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: key_gen] [Low-Order Scalars] Does key_gen ensure the private key has sufficient entropy and isn't a small scalar, or can low-order keys be generated enabling brute-force attacks on encrypted data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: key_gen] [Memory Leakage] After key_gen completes, is the private key scalar properly zeroized from memory, or does it remain in process memory enabling cold boot attacks or memory dump analysis? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: key_gen] [Public Key Validation] Does key_gen validate that the computed public key pk = G::generator_mul(&sk) is a valid non-identity group element, or can invalid public keys be generated causing encryption failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: key_gen] [RNG State Reuse] If the same RNG instance is reused across multiple key_gen calls, can RNG state correlation leak information about generated keys or enable key prediction attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: key_gen] [Deterministic Key Generation] Can an attacker force deterministic key generation by controlling the RNG input, generating identical keypairs across multiple validators and breaking confidentiality? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: key_gen] [Side-Channel Leakage] Does key_gen perform constant-time operations, or can timing/power analysis during keypair generation leak bits of the private key to local or network attackers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: key_gen] [Key Strength Verification] Does key_gen verify that generated keys meet minimum security strength requirements, or can weak keys be generated under edge conditions in the group implementation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: key_gen] [Generator Validation] Does key_gen validate that the group generator used in G::generator_mul is of the correct order, or can an incorrect generator produce weak keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Randomness Reuse] If the same random scalar r is used in multiple encrypt calls, can an attacker recover the private key or plaintext by analyzing ciphertext patterns across multiple encryptions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Public Key Validation] Does encrypt validate that the input public key pk is a valid non-identity group element, or can encrypting to invalid/identity keys expose plaintexts or cause undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Plaintext Validation] Does encrypt validate that the message msg is a valid group element, or can invalid messages cause cryptographic failures or leak information through error patterns? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Zero Randomness] Does encrypt ensure the ephemeral scalar r is non-zero, or can zero randomness lead to ciphertexts that leak the plaintext directly as c0=identity, c1=msg? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt] [Malleability Attack] Since ElGamal is multiplicatively homomorphic, can an attacker modify ciphertext (c0, c1) to produce valid ciphertexts for related plaintexts, enabling unauthorized fund transfers or state manipulation? (High)
